# The Join Function

The join function is a powerful tool for data management and manipulation, merging large datasets efficiently. It is used to combine datasets across observations (rows) and/or variables (columns). 

The join function is most commonly found in packages such as dplyr or data.table, as well as other packages.

The join function is particularly useful when you need to combine two or more datasets. It is also a useful way to create a backup copy of a dataset without saving the entire dataset in memory.
